image.altText: Stephen Mullighan holds the 2025 SA state budget papers as he stands oustide with tall city buildings behind him

props.synopsis: Despite saying South Australia doesn't have a law and order problem, the Malinauskas government has delivered a budget which spruiks funding for law and order, including a $172 million spend to increase the state's police force.

title.children: The curious case of South Australia's law and order budget

image.altText: Image of man with serious face and black shirt

props.synopsis: A man who "savagely" attacked and stabbed former Bachelorette contestant Paddy Colliar, who was working as a topless waiter at a 60th birthday party, has been jailed for at least four years.

title.children: Man jailed for four years over stabbing of 'good Samaritan' former reality TV contestant

image.altText: Forestry in SA's south-east

props.synopsis: As Australia looks to meet housing construction targets, companies in SA and Victoria's Green Triangle are investing more heavily in softwood timber.

title.children: Housing demand drives forestry companies' shift from blue gum to pine

image.altText: John Griffin

props.synopsis: John Edward Tilly Griffin has been jailed for more than nine years for the manslaughter of Gary Robinson at Port Neill in September 2023, in which Mr Robinson was left covered in shampoo, sprinkles and birdseed.

title.children: Killer inflicted 'blows of considerable force' before throwing sprinkles on victim

image.altText: A protest sign sits next to a council sign.

props.synopsis: Port Lincoln residents push back against a proposal from their council to develop five parcels of land for housing.

title.children: Residents say council push to develop green space 'concerning'

image.altText: A close-up of a man with white hair and glasses looking directly into the camera with a wall behind him

props.synopsis: A man who had "formal" and "informal" arrangements with South Australia's Department for Child Protection to house First Nations children has pleaded not guilty to more than 40 charges including sexual offending against minors.

title.children: Man who worked with SA's child protection department pleads not guilty to child sex offences

image.altText: Pigs in a pen.

props.synopsis: About 270 people will lose their jobs and multiple communities will be impacted with the pending closure of a rural South Australian pork processing plant.

title.children: Pork abattoir closure rubs 'salt in injury' for drought-hit towns

image.altText: A purple sign reads Vinarchy, Redefining Wine. It is surrounded by two yellow tanks.

props.synopsis: A global wine giant will close two well-known cellar doors in South Australia's key wine regions, creating uncertainty for staff.

title.children: Wine giant's shock closure of Banrock Station end of a 'fantastic marriage'

image.altText: A man in a high-visibility shirt with his arm around his teenage son, who is also wearing a high-visibility shirt

props.synopsis: Businesses are feeling flow-on impacts and cutting jobs after Whyalla's steelworks went into administration.

title.children: Job losses flow down the line from troubled SA steelworks

image.altText: A woman squats next to a lagoon with a small crab in her hand

props.synopsis: Wild storms push an algal bloom off SA's coast into the Coorong's lagoons, leaving the water "as thick as pea soup" and alarming fishers.

title.children: Scientist 'in tears' as algal bloom kills creatures in SA's Coorong

image.altText: Katrine hildyard in a blazer speaking into microphones in front of a large painting

props.synopsis: The bill passed in the upper house during a late-night sitting on Tuesday, after securing enough support from the state's crossbench.

title.children: New SA child protection laws pass but advocates say reforms don't go far enough

image.altText: A close

props.synopsis: Four years after fleeing Hong Kong, outspoken pro-democracy advocate Ted Hui continues to be the target of an intimidation campaign, which the SA Law Society has denounced.

title.children: Pro-democracy activist targeted in 'deeply concerning' intimidation campaign

image.altText: Aziz Behich is congratulated by teammates

props.synopsis: Nobody will confuse the Socceroos' victory over Japan as anything other than the most desperate of smash-and-grab victories. But in the end, in the vibe-fuelled world of international football, does that even matter?

title.children: Japan had torn the Socceroos apart, but one magic moment changed the narrative

image.altText: A man in a formal suit stands in front of a PNG flag.

props.synopsis: Papua New Guinea's peak anti-corruption body is on the brink of implosion, senior staff say, as its Australian and New Zealand bosses accuse each other of criminal activity.

title.children: Australian anti-corruption boss faces arrest warrant in PNG

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie speaks to the camera

props.synopsis: Tasmanian Premier Jeremy Rockliff says he plans to call a state election as early as next Tuesday, after losing a no-confidence motion by a single vote.

title.children: Jeremy Rockliff aiming to call Tasmanian election on Tuesday

image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: Health issues "planted" and mushrooms weighed to determine fatal doses. Here's how accused triple-murderer Erin Patterson responded to a number of accusations the prosecutions put forward during cross-examination.

title.children: Patterson responds to prosecution accusations in mushroom murder trial

props.synopsis: The BBC says its team of journalists and crew were "tied up, blindfolded, strip searched, interrogated and threatened."

title.children: BBC journalists held at gunpoint and strip-searched by Israeli military, says broadcaster

image.altText: man with red har and striped beanie and brown tshirt holds up grey furry rat in the grassy highlands and mountains behind.

props.synopsis: A species of giant rat, the size of a small terrier, has been documented in New Guinea's highlands for the first time.

title.children: Terrier-sized 'woolly' rat caught on camera for first time

image.altText: anthony albanese points towards reporters outside parliament house in canberra

props.synopsis: Labor leaned into attacking Peter Dutton and was never afraid to name him. With Sussan Ley, the prime minister might adopt the Bob Carr approach.

title.children: Albanese unlikely to use his approach to Dutton with new opponent Ley

image.altText: the photo of a greyhound track with a board showing the names of the dogs

props.synopsis: The new track was spruiked as having animal welfare at its core, but several dogs have died as a result of injuries at the venue during pre-opening trials.

title.children: Greyhounds die from injuries before Queensland track officially opens

image.altText: A side by side image of Trump in a suit raising a thumb and Biden in a suit.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says the alleged conspiracy — a cover-up of Joe Biden's cognitive decline — marks "one of the most dangerous and concerning scandals in American history".

title.children: Trump orders probe into Joe Biden's alleged use of 'autopen'

image.altText: Trump and Xi shake hands with the American and Chinese flags in the background

props.synopsis: The US president posted on Truth Social that a phone call with his Chinese counterpart lasted an hour and a half and "focused almost entirely on trade".

title.children: Trump confirms China visit after speaking to Xi on phone

image.altText: Bunches of flowers under a sign reading: Hillcrest Primary School

props.synopsis: The magistrate's decision may end one chapter of the Hillcrest tragedy, but the case will remain before the courts, with a coronial inquest and civil lawsuit still to play out.

title.children: Magistrate to hand down Hillcrest jumping castle tragedy decision today

image.altText: A website reads 'This is the beginning of the journey to your dreams'.

props.synopsis: Liquidators have identified more than 1,100 clients with claims totalling about $870,000 from an international student agency that collapsed earlier this year.

title.children: Collapsed international student agency may have traded while insolvent

image.altText: A man and a woman hugging

props.synopsis: The Israeli prime minister revealed the bodies of Judy Weinstein-Hagi and Gadi Hagi have been retrieved from Gaza by Israeli forces.

title.children: Israeli PM Netanyahu says bodies of two hostages retrieved from Gaza

image.altText: A pianist performs on stage, with a large screen displaying his late wife on a waterfront in the background.

props.synopsis: In 1971, Vincenzo Pandolfi's life changed when a chance meeting introduced him to "the light of his life", Elaine. Even in the face of illness and heartbreak, the enduring power of their love continues.

title.children: 'She was the light of my life': How a chance meeting sparked a 50-year love story

image.altText: Woman stands with weight loss drug injection in her hands.

props.synopsis: The warning comes after the agency received 40 reports relating to unintended pregnancies while using such weight loss drugs.

title.children: Pregnancy warning to women taking 'skinny jabs' like Ozempic and Mounjaro

image.altText: Daly Cherry-Evans prepares to pass the ball against the Knights.

props.synopsis: Manly captain Daly Cherry-Evans claims he is unsure if he has done enough to retain his spot in the Queensland squad for State of Origin II.

title.children: Cherry-Evans in the dark over Origin future after Sea Eagles' loss

image.altText: GettyImages-2218028431

props.synopsis: Jack Ginnivan is unapologetic after taunting the Western Bulldogs in Hawthorn's 22-point win on Thursday night.

title.children: 'Bro can't have fun': Hawks star unmoved after taunting Bulldogs

image.altText: Alan Stockdale stands in front of Liberal branding

props.synopsis: This week in politics the parliament has achieved gender parity despite tone-deaf commentary, an independent triumphed after a recount and Dorinda Cox changed her tune.

title.children: Liberal men still struggle to read the room when it comes to women

image.altText: A drone shot of Thredbo Resort

props.synopsis: Snow is expected to fall in NSW for the official start of ski season this weekend, despite fears warmer forecasts could spoil conditions over winter.

title.children: Snowy start to NSW ski season as traders 'nervous' about warm winter

image.altText: Russian President Vladimir Putin stands in front of two iranian flags and a russian flag

props.synopsis: Russian President Vladimir Putin has told US President Donald Trump that he is ready to use Russia's close partnership with Iran to help with negotiations over Iran's nuclear programme.

title.children: Putin ready to help Trump on Iran nuclear negotiations

image.altText: Australia's Bec Rawlings was crowned the 'Queen of Bare Knuckle' after her win in two rounds over Alma Garcia.

props.synopsis: The WA Combat Sports Commission declines an application for professional bare-knuckle boxing fights.

title.children: Australian-first bare-knuckle fighting event denied for Perth

image.altText: Two security guards walk past a line of motorbikes outside Bali's Kerobokan prison.

props.synopsis: An Australian man has been arrested in Bali on suspicion of drug possession, Indonesian authorities say.

title.children: Australian man arrested for drug possession in Bali

image.altText: Morten Harket posing for a photo in front of a bush

props.synopsis: A-ha lead singer Morten Harket shared the news of the diagnosis on the band's website, revealing he's already undergone several rounds of brain surgery.

title.children: A-ha frontman Morten Harket diagnosed with Parkinson's disease
